Reviews.Title: “Not a 3.5* but not the worst I guess. TIGHT room for single occupancy”
Reviews.Author: arabxesque
Reviews.Content: This hotel's rooms were pretty tiny - which is no big deal in Istanbul. But I don't consider this a 3.5* hotel (in fact many of the star ratings for Istanbul hotels are a bit bloated). The bathroom was tiny - I found it a bit tough to shower (and I'm not a prissy dude). Also the window was broken & didn't close - something I know the person who showed me to the room noticed (since he tried to close it) but then ignored. The room was crammed but comfortable. TV is ok. Internet ok. The area is beautiful. But this is no 3.5*. It was like an Ikea set was tossed into my room. The hotel is pretty overpriced in my opinion - but as I said, is in a great location (so they can overprice I guess).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel experience depends on the room you get”
Reviews.Author: meanchat
Reviews.Content: My son and I were incorrectly booked into this hotel through an online travel service. Although we tried to change it, because the room was prepaid and we could not get through to the booking agent in Europe, we had no choice but to stay. The room they showed us was awful with peeling paint and facing the back - claustrophobic and dingy. We paid a premium as I see some of the other travelers had done for the deluxe room on the top floor. The room was really nothing special; however, it was the view that was the redeeming factor. It had wrap-around windows with views of the Galata tower and with no high buildings across the street, the room was very bright - too bright, in fact, if you wanted to sleep in late. The location was convenient and the breakfast, although not extensive, was fine. If you can get the deluxe room, it is worth it for the view as you really get a nice feeling of the city. if not, there are better options in the city for the price range (i.e. Mia Pera).

Reviews.Title: “Got an awesome view”
Reviews.Author: LangersInLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this as it had been recommended by a friend as cheap and in a great location. Booked a really cheap deal on booking.com but then when we checked in the manager haggled with us to get us to pay a bit extra for the "luxury room" We checked out the room that we had originally booked - it seemed fine, a little small but very clean with nice furnishings but then they showed us the luxury room and I decided it was well worth the extra! The room was easily 3 times the size of the standard and the view was just amazing! Windows all the way round with a beautiful view of the river, Galata Tower and the Blue Mosque in the distance. Amazing. The location is great, Metro just opposite and Tunnel just round the corner. Plus Taksim is an easy walk. Hotel itself is nice enough. Nothing fancy but very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't bother with breakfast each day as was always busy & we couldn't be bothered to wait. As long as you bargain with them to get yourself a good price, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rong198
Reviews.Content: Heart of pera neighborhood near taksim square. Fun shops, restaurants, bars nearby. The place itself was nothing special. twin room had two twin beds, was not large, but was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough.”
Reviews.Author: blackford1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me by a Turkish friend who is from Istanbul, and it was a reasonably good choice. First off the negatives: the room and bathroom were very small, even by European standards, there is some street noise as the hotel is located near a popular nightlife area, and there are no English language channels on the television. Now the positives: the room was clean and stylish, breakfast was decent for such a small hotel (less than 30 rooms total), and the staff spoke some English and were helpful in booking tours, even though this hotel seems to cater mostly to people visiting from other parts of Turkey. This hotel is just a block off of the main shopping street of Istanbul, with lots of nice restaurants and nice stores to choose from. It's not particularly close to any of the main historical sites, though, and it required either a taxi ride or a combination of funicular and streetcar rides to get to the main tourist areas. This is probably not a great choice for the typical tourist in town for just a few days to see the sights, but if you want to be in the Taksim area and don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room anyways, then this hotel would be okay.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all!”
Reviews.Author: pinarpiotr
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed when we saw our room in this hotel. Firstly, I think they gave us a smoking room instead of non-smoking because the air was terrible. No windows, no views nothing. Just a door opening to a fire escape stairs surrounded by a wall. The room was extremely small and the breakfast was very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Fell short of my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Angelique35
Reviews.Content: 100 euro per night for a double room was way too much money for this hotel. (though around new year's eve). The room was OK in size and clean but you could see damp marks on the wall and the douche cabin was the worst I've ever seen. Way too small and the door fell down while taking a shower. Also no central heating in the room, only airco, which is not the best idea for heating up a room in cold nights. Breakfast was plain. In total, I regretted spending my money in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small, really small, but excellent location&friendly personal...”
Reviews.Author: Dizelonline
Reviews.Content: used this hotel for second visit in Stambul. 7 nights. Location: Really excellent location (we've started to understand after few days)))... just 20 meters from metro station (good for shopping), and just 2 min to Istiklal and Tunnel stop (best for walking around Beyoglu and going down to Galata Bridge and Sultanahmet). There are a lots of bar, club and restaurant betwean the hotel and Taksim, so you can also have a good evening drink ))) Rooms & service: Really VERY small, in the brink of fall. Rooms clean, but sometimes there was a dust under the bed (only place for our case).... Breakfast was really very poor (granulate coffee - IT'S TERRIBLE), so that's why we went up to Istiklal for normal coffee and sandwich in Gloria Jeans Coffee ))) Other: There's no discount for cash payment (in some hotels i've god 7-10% discount from the booking price). Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms, Good Service and Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: francc
Reviews.Content: I do like this hotel very much and its one of the best in its classification . I have been to Turkey 15 times and so have stayed in many classes of hotels and hotels in different areas, some once some multiple times. This hotel i will return too for sure. The hotel is extremely well located in Pera which is at one end of Istiklal Caddesi, just 3 minutes down the stairs from the top of the Tunel and across a small street from the metro. The rooms are medium sized and well furnished. The beds and pillows are of good quality. Hundreds of channels on their TV. Bathroom is new clean and decent sized and there is an abundance of hot water and pressure is good. Many rooms face the front and are bright and sunny and even though its on the street there isnt much noise except occasionally when some idiot a distance away decides to sound his horn impatiently and no audible call to prayers. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. I almost never wake up in time for breakfast so cant say much however even when I was up late and breakfast was no where in sight I was always offered coffee or tea. Excellent Value Surely.

Reviews.Title: “Good low-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lon39don39
Reviews.Content: The hotel is Â£70 a night and so cheap for a very popular area with plenty of good bars, restaurants and clubs. If you're on a budget and want a plain room that's just for sleeping, washing, etc. and more money to spend on Istanbul then staying here makes sense. The spec of the rooms is low-ish but fine. Beds are comfortable, sheets and towels clean. One warning - if you are overweight you won't squeeze through the shower doors. There were four of us staying and we wondered how more generously proportioned people would manage. Our room faced away from the street but soundproofing's not great so we could hear conversation above, and children clumping about and squealing. Breakfast very simple. Wi-fi free and good connection. Don't stay here for a romantic break as the spec is too plain. Otherwise, it's very well-located, just next to the Tunel funicular that'll take you down to the tram for the historical sights but 5 minutes from the main drag of Istiklal Caddesi and the bars and restaurants of the Pera district. If you want the feel of a local quarter then this will be too busy an area. This was my first time in Istanbul and it's a mass consumer and mass tourist city so plan carefully if you don't like hordes of people everywhere you go. Hotel staff varied from friendly to neutral but I got the feeling that some were slightly fed-up of tourists who spoke no Turkish. There were also a lot of fellow guests who felt like Turkish out-of-towners coming to see the big city. It was fine but I'd probably fork out Â£20 a night more next time and stay somewhere a bit higher spec.

Reviews.Title: “Certain rooms are better than others, shower stalls way too tiny.”
Reviews.Author: jollybychance
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed here on 2 occasions as we make our way from Istanbul around other parts of Turkey and back to Istanbul. Depending on which side of the building your room is located, it can make a huge difference. The double rooms facing the street (the 01 and 02 rooms, except on 8th floor) are extremely small and very hot in the afternoon because the sun beats directly into the rooms even with the curtains drawn. There is a very tiny balcony but only enough for standing, if you can make it through the door of the balcony in the first place (because the rooms are so small). The bathroom door to these rooms work by some sort of pressure, so you need to bang the door shut in order for it to stay shut. The double rooms facing the back has a spiral staircase (we stayed in 802, as well as 503, 603) and offers a larger space and are much cooler because the sun doesnt reach here as much. The bathroom door is turn-knob and doesn't have the same problem as the rooms on the other side. However, because of the way the room is angled in an L shape, you will not be able to watch TV while lying in bed because the bathroom door is by the bed foot of the bed and the TV at the L angle. WIFI is free but if you are using Apple products you might have problem with flickering network, so u will need them to give u some code to change the dns server number or something like that. The shower stalls in all rooms are way too tiny. I am 1.73m and weight about 52kg and I have problems showering without hitting my limbs against the sliding doors (which are already damaged in the room I stayed in) or the shower head. The space is way too small. The sink is also so small, it's impossible to wash your face or brush your teeth without getting the floor wet. I am usually not picky with hotels, but this one is quite a disappointment. I don't know how much they charge per night as it was booked by our agent and included in the package price but unless it's really cheap, I don't recommend it. Location wise there are other hotels in the vicinity like Tulip Pera and Marmara Pera that offer better spots, close to the main shopping street. Staff was alright, no one to rave about. Because the street is very narrow and no parking was available outside the hotel, we had to wheel our own luggages to the pick up van further down the street when we checked out on the last day. Seems like they don't have many staff. Breakfast was traditional Turkish style, simple and good enough for us. The hotel is quaint and rooms are pretty, but it is way too small for my personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Unreasonably tiny rooms for the price; Slow response; Good location”
Reviews.Author: JayDee27
Reviews.Content: The Pera Hotel was a disappointment. The location of the hotel is great if you want good bars, cafes within walking distance; and the rooms are clean and tidy. However, the rooms are EXTREMELY small... my *double* room was roughly 8 feet by 7.5 feet - felt more like a cell than a hotel room! I usually don't care much about room size (after all, you spend time in the room only when sleeping) but this size was very uncomfortable for my wife and I. We were traveling two small carry-on size bags, and there was no place in the room to put them. If you needed to walk, you'd have to lift the bag and put it on the bed, so you could walk. And while sleeping, you'd have to put the bag back on the floor. The Bathroom was the same story. The ENTIRE bathroom (including shower, toilet etc.) was 3.5 feet by 3.5 feet... very uncomfortable. We had 6 couples staying in the hotel for the weekend, and all except one, had the same issue with room size. Even though the rooms are clean and tidy, in my opinion, this hotel is way overpriced for the rooms it has (we paid 140 Turkish Liras per double room)

Reviews.Title: “a good place for a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bibi321
Reviews.Content: Nice location, just about 200 meters away from the main street in Taksim. The hotel is really small - maybe about 20 rooms only and did not have a lot of visitors at the time we were there. The staff is polite and friendly, but they can work on improving their English. The rooms are also quite small and the bathroom is tiny. Our shower was broken. There is an LCD TV in the room but I think they only had Turkish channels. Overall it is a good place for a 3 star hotel but we found it a bit too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and friendly service, charming and comfy rooms, delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Viola2010
Reviews.Content: The Pera Hotel has wonderful service and beautiful rooms at a great price. Our beds were super comfortable (and I loved the spotless white comforters). The showers were hot, and breakfast (yummy breads, cereal, hard boiled eggs, cucumbers, olives, cheese, juice/coffee/tea) is served every morning. The hotel has free wireless access and a computer for guests to use in the lobby. The hotel is about a one-minute walk to a popular shopping street with retail stores and many restaurants. (There's also a Turkish bath nearby.) Plus, it's easy to get to other popular tourist destinations, such as the Sultanahmet, by foot or tram. On the whole, the Pera had a very cosmopolitan feel!

Reviews.Title: “very nice, new hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KVS83
Reviews.Content: hotel is new, very clean, the stuff is great. There are many restaurants and shops around hotel, 1 min on foot from Istiklal Street and you can also walk to the old part of the city - it takes about 25 min. If you don't like this idea you can use Tunnel or metro, the stations are just in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, cozy small hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ibismia
Reviews.Content: This is a cozy small hotel, located in the trendy Pera district. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to enjoy the clubs, cafes and restaurants in this area. It can get loud on Friday and Saturday nights, but if you are out and about it might as well. If you are the kind of person that enjoys large hotels with room service then this is not the hotel for you. The rooms are good in size but the bathrooms are very small, specially the showers. We got one of the two suites available and the view was breathtaking. We had a 180 degree view of Istanbul and the magnificent Bosphorus. Suites have larger bathrooms and showers in case you are wondering. The staff is very friendly and kind. They will go out of their way to help. They make a very good job in making you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “quite nice”
Reviews.Author: kkalev
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, on a very good location, nice staff, clean. A bit small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay, taksim's hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: shishmish
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth time in Istanbul and this hotel was a really good value for the money. The location is great - right next to Istiklal Cad., one of Istanbul's most fashionable streets. The bathrooms are really small but very clean. The hotel is brand new and was missing certain amenities claimed to have - such as WiFi or TV in the room. But, the hotel staff was exceptionally helpful and really tried to correct the problem, so we did not take it against them. We will stay at this hotel next time we are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: demetrios
Reviews.Content: Rarely ever do I book in a hotel that is not listed with Trip Advisor. The Pera Hotel was not at the time I made the arrangements, because it was brand new. I decided to give it a shot though, exactly because it was brand new, and the price (at 68 euro per room per night) sounded quite tempting. Thankfully, I did not regret it. This place is rather on the small side (with only 21 rooms) but intimate. It is very conveniently located so it can be the starting point of many excursions around Istanbul. For those who know the city, it's two minutes walk from the Tunel (and therefore also two minutes away from the end of the old tramway). Also right in front of its entrance it's the gate of the brand new Sishane metro station. Location is therefore one of the strong points of this place. Another strong point (THE strongest in my opinion) is the friendliness and the service mindedness of the personnel. We were traveling with a six month old baby and we were rather worried about how easy that would be. Well, ALL the people at the hotel went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. They made us feel that it was not a professional relationship, but a genuine interest and friendliness. Anything we asked for we got with a smile. On the plus side, the Internet connection was free fast and the signal crystal clear. Our room (703) was comfortable (but the view nothing worth talking about). The water pressure at the shower was good (not to be taken for granted in Istanbul). All in all if you think about the relationship of value for money, then this is a BIG plus. On the minus side, the only thing I can find is that the breakfast place is small and the food variety for breakfast is not what I have been used to. Fresh and tasty but small variety of choices. All in all though, we have been very satisfied with our stay in the Pera Hotel and whenever we go back to Istanbul it's going to be our first choice again. Highly recommended!
